page.title: 07Farming
page.content: There are 21 farms in our area. The biggest farm is Sampford Farm. It has 255 cows, 225 sheep, 3995 pigs and 3 horses. The horses are not cart horses, they are hunters. The farm has got 385 acres. The farmer did have more land but he sold 20 acres. He uses some of his land for corn and most of his land for grass for his animals. He feeds his pigs on pig nuts. There is one other big farm in our village. It is called Home Farm. It has 60 cattle and 110 sheep. In the winter our survey has shown that most farmers feed their animals hay, silage and cake. They use their land mainly for grazing and crops. The main crops are corn, barley and potatoes. An east-facing slope is best for potatoes because the sun shines on it nearly all day.
